issue.title: [Python] Missing Python tests for compute kernels
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14135](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14135). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
PyArrow is missing tests for several compute kernels.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14135?focusedCommentId=17420685) by David Li (lidavidm):*
I don't think we need separate tests unless the Python bindings have additional logic or handwritten bindings, and I don't think we need to slot this in for 6.0.0.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14135?focusedCommentId=17420899) by Eduardo Ponce (edponce):*
Oh, I see, it makes sense to not duplicate testing the same (non-changed) kernels from PyArrow.
I will close this JIRA.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14135?focusedCommentId=17421291) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Note that eg any kernel with options, even when the kernel itself is autogenerated, has handwritten bindings for the options, and should ideally have at least a basic test.

(I didn't check which kernels are of concern here, though, or whether there are any untested kernels that do have an options class)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14135?focusedCommentId=17421446) by Eduardo Ponce (edponce):*
`[~jorisvandenbossche]` In this issue I was referring to kernels that do not have **FunctionOptions** or Python-specific implementation, so these are the ones binded automatically. Recently, in ARROW-13327, I consolidated/verify **FunctionOptions** including tests. But it never hurts to double-check if there are missing tests for kernels with Python options and/or implementation.
